questions.question: Is there music playing nearby?
Are there audio-based interactives nearby?
Are there artificial lights pointing towards the enclosure, either static or moving/flashing?
How busy is the attraction today?
What's the temperature like today?
What's the weather like today? Pick the option that matches the closest.
Can the animal approach and avoid conspecifics or other species in the enclosure?
Can the animal perform appropriate levels of self-care behaviours (e.g. grooming, feeding, drinking, resting, comfort activities)?
Does the animal have mostly positive, non-harmful interactions and relationships with conspecifics or other animals?
Does the animal have mostly positive or neutral interactions and relationships with staff?
Does the animal have mostly neutral or positive experiences of visitors (i.e. non-aggressive/fearful/aversive)?
Does the animal respond appropriately to novel changes in the environment (e.g. enrichment) with interest rather than aversion and fear?
Can the animal express choice and control over being in indoor/outdoor areas of enclosure, except for enclosure cleaning, maintenance, and feeding?
Can the animal patrol/maintain territory in the enclosure, as appropriate?
Can the animal perform appropriate foraging (searching for food) and feeding (consuming food) behaviours?
Can the animal play, alone or socially?
Can the animal achieve appropriate levels and patterns of rest and sleep?
Can the animal experience tactile pleasures such as social grooming, scratching on substrates?
Can the animal express motivated courtship and mating behaviours?
Can the animal express species-specific ‘behavioural needs’ such as rooting, nest-building?
Does the animal perform normal behaviours? (e.g. no signs of self-injurious, stereotyping)
If abnormal behaviours are known, are measures in place to understand the causes of this behaviour and if/how it may be reduced or eliminated?

questions.section: 1B: Physical Health - Animal-Based Indicators of Welfare

questions.question: Does the animal appear to be in good physical condition (e.g. no abnormal discharge; good condition of pelage, plumage, skin, scale, scute, teeth, horn)?
Does the animal have signs of being pain-free? (e.g. no signs of wincing, flinching, lameness)
Does the animal have a ‘body condition score’ and/or body mass within normal limits?
Does the animal have good muscle definition and tone?
Does the animal have appropriately formed faeces?
Does the animal have expected movement/strenth? (Eg. no signs of debility/weakness)
Does the animal have good on-going health? (Eg. no known recurring *acute* disease/injury)
Does the animal have good on-going health? (Eg. no known *chronic* disease/injury)
Does the animal have routine health checks at appropriate intervals?
Does the animal have parasitology screenings/treatments at appropriate intervals?
Can the animal drink from water on demand?
Can the animal drink from a clean, fresh water source?
Can the animal consume an appropriate quantity of food?
Can the animal consume a high-quality, nutritious diet?
Can the animal consume an appropriately presented diet (consider timing, format, position in enclosure, social interactions)?
Does the animal have an appropriate temperature level, which may include a temperature gradient or access to shaded and heated areas?
Does the animal have an appropriate humidity level, which may include a humidity gradient?
Does the animal have high air quality, free of pollutants, heavy dust and aversive odours, and is well-ventilated?
Does the animal have appropriate lighting frequency/colour/brightness, without flicker or glare?
Does the animal have an appropriate photoperiod (light-dark cycle)?
Does the animal have appropriate sound pressure (audible noise, vibration) levels?
Does the animal have adequate size, shape and topography for animal exercise and territory exploration?
Does the animal have appropriate substrate for locomotion (abrasion, traction, support)?
Does the animal have appropriate shelters, retreats, off-show/out-of-sight areas away from visitors and conspecifics?
Does the animal have an enclosure which is safe and secure with no or mitigated risk of harm (e.g. fences and barriers)?
